title: Capacity
review: The gentle instrumentation and powerful storytelling of this album work together to immerse you in a world that feels younger, more naive, but at the same time road-wearied and desperate for connection.

title: Hesitation Marks
review: A triumphant return from one of the greats.  Driving rhythms and harsh vocals remind us of the high points from the 90s.

title: The Lonesome Crowded West
review: Who knew someone could hate shopping malls this much?  Everyone is on top of their game in this genre defining classic.

title: Kill For Love
review: Lush electronics and hushed vocals work together to bring out a feeling of driving around LA at 2 in the morning, unsure of what is going to happen next.

title: Man Alive
review: The transition to fatherhood was always going to be difficult but I don't think anyone expected it to be this morose.  Archie Marshall is at his most tortured in some of the more desperate moments of his most recent effort.
